Extended Diagnostics - [Versioning and releases](https://angular.dev/reference/releases) - [Version compatibility](https://angular.dev/reference/versions) - [Update guide](https://angular.dev/update-guide) - Configurations - Migrations - arrow\_backError Encyclopedia - [Overview](https://angular.dev/errors) - [NG0100: Expression Changed After Checked](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0100) - [NG01101: Wrong Async Validator Return Type](https://angular.dev/errors/NG01101) - [NG01203: Missing value accessor](https://angular.dev/errors/NG01203) - [NG0200: Circular Dependency in DI](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0200) - [NG0201: No Provider Found](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0201) - [NG0203: \`inject()\` must be called from an injection context](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0203) - [NG0209: Invalid multi provider](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0209) - [NG02200: Missing Iterable Differ](https://angular.dev/errors/NG02200) - [NG02800: JSONP support in HttpClient configuration](https://angular.dev/errors/NG02800) - [NG0300: Selector Collision](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0300) - [NG0301: Export Not Found](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0301) - [NG0302: Pipe Not Found](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0302) - [NG0403: Bootstrapped NgModule doesn't specify which component to initialize](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0403) - [NG0500: Hydration Node Mismatch](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0500) - [NG05000: Hydration with unsupported Zone.js instance](https://angular.dev/errors/NG05000) - [NG0501: Hydration Missing Siblings](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0501) - [NG0502: Hydration Missing Node](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0502) - [NG0503: Hydration Unsupported Projection of DOM Nodes](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0503) - [NG0504: Skip hydration flag is applied to an invalid node](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0504) - [NG0505: No hydration info in server response](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0505) - [NG0506: Application remains unstable](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0506) - [NG0507: HTML content was altered after server-side rendering](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0507) - [NG05104: Root element was not found](https://angular.dev/errors/NG05104) - [NG0602: Disallowed function call inside reactive context](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0602) - [NG0750: @defer dependencies failed to load](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0750) - [NG0751: @defer behavior when HMR is enabled](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0751) - [NG0910: Unsafe bindings on an iframe element](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0910) - [NG0912: Component ID generation collision](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0912) - [NG0913: Runtime Performance Warnings](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0913) - [NG0950: Required input is accessed before a value is set.](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0950) - [NG0951: Child query result is required but no value is available.](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0951) - [NG0955: Track expression resulted in duplicated keys for a given collection.](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0955) - [NG0956: Tracking expression caused re-creation of the DOM structure.](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0956) - [NG1001: Argument Not Literal](https://angular.dev/errors/NG1001) - [NG2003: Missing Token](https://angular.dev/errors/NG2003) - [NG2009: Invalid Shadow DOM selector](https://angular.dev/errors/NG2009) - [NG3003: Import Cycle Detected](https://angular.dev/errors/NG3003) - [NG6100: NgModule.id Set to module.id anti-pattern](https://angular.dev/errors/NG6100) - [NG8001: Invalid Element](https://angular.dev/errors/NG8001) - [NG8002: Invalid Attribute](https://angular.dev/errors/NG8002) - [NG8003: Missing Reference Target](https://angular.dev/errors/NG8003) This site uses cookies from Google to deliver its services and to analyze traffic. [Learn more](https://policies.google.com/technologies/cookies) Ok, Got it The identity track expression specified in the `@for` loop caused re-creation of the DOM corresponding to _all_ items. This is a very expensive operation that commonly occurs when working with immutable data structures. For example: ``` @Component({ template: `
    @for (todo of todos; track todo) {
  • {{todo.task}}
    • }
`,})export class App { todos = [ { id: 0, task: 'understand trackBy', done: false }, { id: 1, task: 'use proper tracking expression', done: false }, ]; toggleAllDone() { this.todos = this.todos.map(todo => ({ ...todo, done: true })); }} ``` check In the provided example, the entire list with all the views (DOM nodes, Angular directives, components, queries, etc.) are re-created (!) after toggling the "done" status of items. Here, a relatively inexpensive binding update to the `done` property would suffice. Apart from having a high performance penalty, re-creating the DOM tree results in loss of state in the DOM elements (ex.: focus, text selection, sites loaded in an iframe, etc.). ## [Fixing the error](https://angular.dev/errors/NG0956\#fixing-the-error) Change the tracking expression such that it uniquely identifies an item in a collection, regardless of its object identity. In the discussed example, the correct track expression would use the unique `id` property ( `item.id`): ``` @Component({ template: `
    @for (todo of todos; track todo.id) {
  • {{todo.task}}
    • }
`,})export class App { todos = [ { id: 0, task: 'understand trackBy', done: false }, { id: 1, task: 'use proper tracking expression', done: false }, ]; toggleAllDone() { this.todos = this.todos.map(todo => ({ ...todo, done: true })); }} ``` check
title: NG0956: Tracking expression caused re-creation of the DOM structure. • Angular
description: The web development framework for building modern apps.
